meanings.definition: A unit of force in the centimeter-gram-second system, equal to the force that produces an acceleration of one centimeter per second per second on a mass of one gram.
meanings.sent1: She measured the force in dynes exerted on the object.
meanings.sent2: The scale showed the weight in dynes of the small mass.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant pushed with a million dynes of strength!
meanings.sent4: The dynes of pressure from the water felt like a gentle hug.
meanings.sent5: The dynes of the magnet pulling the metal were surprisingly strong.

meanings.definition: A unit of force in the meter-kilogram-second system, equal to the force that produces an acceleration of one meter per second per second on a mass of one kilogram.
meanings.sent1: The machine calculated the force in dynes required to move the heavy object.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's jump generated several dynes of force on impact.
meanings.sent3: The dynes of the vacuum cleaner made cleaning the room a breeze!
meanings.sent4: The dynes of the wind against the sail propelled the boat forward.
meanings.sent5: The dynes of the earthquake shook the ground with incredible power.
